events.description: The first monetary policy decision of the year where the RBI maintained the key repo rate at 5.25%.
The RBI cut the repo rate by 25 bps in the final meeting of 2025.
Government budget that boosted spending and influenced economic growth expectations.

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% in February 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) maintained its key repo rate at 5.25% during its February 2026 meeting

facts.fact_text: India's annual inflation was 1.33% in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: India’s annual inflation accelerated to 1.33% in December 2025

facts.fact_text: India's GDP grew by 8.2% in the September quarter.

evidences.evidence_text: GDP grew 8.2% in the September quarter.

facts.fact_text: The RBI kept the SDF rate at 5.0% and the MSF rate at 5.50%.

evidences.evidence_text: The RBI also kept the SDF rate at 5.0% and the MSF rate at 5.50%.

claims.claim_text: The RBI raised its GDP growth forecast for FY2025/26 to 7.4%.
claims.author: Reserve Bank of India

evidences.evidence_text: the RBI raised its GDP growth forecast for FY2025/26 to 7.4%, up from its earlier estimate of 7.3%.

claims.claim_text: Inflation for FY26 is projected to be 2.1%.
claims.author: Reserve Bank of India

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, inflation for FY26 is projected at 2.1%.

claims.claim_text: The Union Budget and US-India trade deals raised expectations for stronger economic growth.

evidences.evidence_text: The decision comes after the Union Budget boosted government spending and US–India trade deals raised expectations of stronger economic growth.

evidence.evidence_text: the Union Budget boosted government spending ... raised expectations of stronger economic growth.
US–India trade deals raised expectations of stronger economic growth.
maintained its key repo rate ... amid confidence in a softer inflation outlook
maintained its key repo rate ... amid confidence in ... improving growth prospects.
